summary: This document is email correspondence from the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It includes a cover email from the judge's chambers transmitting an order and a forwarded email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney submitting a sealed motion to preclude cross-examination. The document shows procedural steps in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Issuing an order in the US v. Maxwell case. Her chambers are sending the correspondence.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain regarding the motion to preclude cross-examination in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Mentioned as a recipient in the email chain regarding the motion to preclude cross-examination in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the case in which AUSA Menninger is a prosecutor, as shown in the court correspondence.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the case in which Pagliuca appears to be involved as counsel, based on the email distribution.

events.title: Order Issued in Maxwell Case
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order in the case US v. Maxwell, which her chambers transmits via email to counsel.

events.title: Sealed Motion to Preclude Filed
events.description: The Government, via an Assistant U.S. Attorney, files a letter motion to preclude cross-examination under seal in the Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The document is procedural correspondence from the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).
An order was issued by Judge Nathan on November 28, 2021, and was to be docketed the following morning.
The Government filed a sealed motion to preclude cross-examination on November 27, 2021, indicating active pre-trial litigation.
The email chain shows communication between the court (Judge Nathan's chambers) and prosecution counsel (including AUSA Laura Menninger).
The document highlights the ongoing legal proceedings and motion practice in the Maxwell trial as of late November 2021.
